channel.description: Recent content in concrete on Tiliaradix Blog

item.title: Build: Subwoofer base
item.description: Buildlog: Subwoofer base ðŸ”—Sneak peek ðŸ”—It stands. Why ðŸ”—We recently bought a soundbar system for our TV. The system includes a subwoofer. Not great, not terrible, but enough to potentially disturb neighbors. This calls for some kind of stand to separate the subwoofer-structure from the house-structure so the big badabooms doesn’t make for disturbance calls. Also, the sides are dressed in a fabric mesh, and I want to raise it from the floor enough so that the vacuum cleaner won’t hit it.

item.title: Build: Big Red Button
item.description: Buildlog: Big Red Button ðŸ”—Sneak peek ðŸ”—Meta ðŸ”—The Big Red Button is a product from Sparkfun that evokes memories of arcade games. With an appealing dome and satisfying loud click, you cannot not click the button. But it lacks an equally appealing enclosure. Let’s build one out of concrete. For this project, I used 1 Texas Instruments Sensortag 1 Adafruit Big Red Button 1 RGB LED Prototyping cables Concrete Various things for concrete mold Why ðŸ”—Why not?
